input_text:
Job Title: Software Engineer in Test

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Our Pitch:Are you tired of being confined to the traditional office environment, constantly told that productivity can only be achieved within its four walls? Do you find yourself yearning for a better work-life balance, where you can thrive professionally while enjoying the comforts of home? If you're a Software Engineer in Test who has discovered the power of remote work and excels in the flexibility it offers, then you've come to the right place. At Mach7, we understand that great work knows no boundaries. We recognize the immense talent and potential of software engineers who prefer to work remotely and are committed to fostering an environment where you can flourish.
What You Will be Doing:As a Senior Software Engineer in Test, you'll be instrumental in spearheading and guiding the design and development of our evolving automation initiatives. Your track record of leading and mentoring automation and quality engineering teams, combined with your extensive technical expertise across diverse automation frameworks, will be pivotal in ensuring the continued delivery of top-tier software solutions to our users.
Your Core Focus:Create, design, and develop all aspects of our automated testing, including creating and running automated regression tests.Develop automation execution reports that communicate failed tests and failure points to stakeholders.Integrate automated tests into the build process for continuous integration using frameworks such as Azure DevOps, Jenkins (either directly or helping DevOps to do it)Monitor automation processes and communicate test results and highlight potential quality risks.Support non-functional testing (stress, performance/load, and security testing) with automation and test data as needed.Review and refactor existing automated tests as well as enhance our automation technology stack to ensure the software quality improvement and efficiency of the tests.Ensure test automation design is traceable to requirements or user stories and achieves a high level of requirement/test coverage.Interact with product manager, development teams and QA colleagues to develop a strong understanding of the project and product testing objectives.Guide and mentor your QA team colleagues and developers on the best practices for automation.

Who you are:Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or Computer Engineering or equivalent experience7+ years of hands-on experience creating and maintaining test automation and associated infrastructure.Proficient in C# with understanding of other object-oriented programming languages like Java.Proven ability to write automated tests including Unit, Integration, Functional and APIs using unit testing tools and frameworks. (NUnit, BUnit, JUnit)Extensive hands-on experience with test automation tools and frameworks such as Selenium, Swagger, Cypress, Appium, NUnit, BUnit, and/or JUnit.Deep knowledge of software testing methodologies, test design techniques, and best practices both manual and automation testing.Experience integrating automation into CI/CD pipelines (such as Azure DevOps, Jenkins).
What sets you apart:with Healthcare standards (HL7, DICOM, XDS).with comprehensive virtualization tools like vSphere Hypervisor or VMware.with containerization and orchestration technology such as Docker and Kubernetes.Experience working with SQL databases.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Software Engineer in Test
output_json.summary: Senior Software Engineer in Test position at Mach7, focusing on automation initiatives and leading a team.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
job_responsibilities: Creating and developing automated testing aspects
Designing and implementing automated regression tests
Integrating automated tests into CI/CD pipelines
Communicating test results and quality risks
Reviewing and refactoring existing automated tests
Ensuring test automation aligns with requirements
Improving software quality and test efficiency
Interacting with product managers, development teams, and QA colleagues
Guiding and mentoring QA team members and developers
